intro: Monnina bangii, commonly known as the Bangi blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slight pubescence. Monnina bangii is often found in moist, sandy soils in open woods and along stream banks.
